instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
Hi all,

This board had a small liquid spill close to battery connector. - symptoms are that it can see the battery but displays replace now and will not charge.
Data lines are okay i assume as it can see the battery.
Battery is a KG OEM.

I've replaced the following:

ISL
All caps and resistors on <SIGNAL>CHGR_VCOMP</SIGNAL> line
<TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> --> pin 5 is 2.2v? (pins 1-3 12.60, pin 4 12.56)
<RESISTOR>R7150</RESISTOR> due to liquid along with <CAPACITOR>C7145</CAPACITOR>
<CAPACITOR>C7155</CAPACITOR>
<CAPACITOR>C7156</CAPACITOR>
<CAPACITOR>C7157</CAPACITOR>

Resistance on pins 17/18 of ISL are: 3.3 ohms (seems high?)
Resistance on pins 27/28 of ISL are: 21.2 ohms

Certainly confused now - any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message: Voltage on PPBUS without the battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
UPDATE: Not sure if this is relevant but - Pin 5 of <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> without a battery is 12.6v and after a few seconds drops to 5v then back up to 12.6v.

with a battery it is solid 2.2v

okay weird - its can sometimes be 12.6v on pin 5 and then back to 2.2v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message: I’ve ordered another battery to test with because I can’t see what else it could be other than the SMC ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
symptoms are that it can see the battery but displays replace now and will not charge

The machine even tells you what to do!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message:
Duke correct as always! Love it, new battery works fine. Not that i'm surprised a new apple battery was DOA...

Thanks again!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging
threads.message: Dream on about "new" batteries. These are all pulled garbage that are reset to 0 cycles and full charge capacity.
